intro: Eranthemum plumbaginoides, commonly known as the silverleaf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features include a woody stem, showy inflorescences, and a preference for warm, humid climates.
